episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the unusual mating habits of armadillos, a unique ear-cleaning practice by the Korowai people of New Guinea, the challenges faced by scientists in a noisy open-plan laboratory, and the unexpected closure of a sunflower farm due to selfie-seeking visitors.

facts.fact: It's very hard for scientists to spot armadillos having sex because armadillos have sex while running.
The Korowai people of New Guinea put grubs in their ears to eat their earwax.
The biggest single biomedical laboratory in Europe designed to encourage scientists to chat more to each other is so noisy that scientists are actually complaining it's too hard to concentrate.
The largest sunflower farm in Ontario has been forced to shut because so many people were taking selfies there.
